main event: Dorothy Deisinger observed a glowing sphere-shaped object hovering above a vineyard in Naples, New York on 26 May 1960.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be the size of a small automobile and moved about 30 feet above the treetops., The object entered the atmosphere from the east and proceeded slowly in a westward direction., The observation lasted for approximately 3 minutes and 30 seconds., The object made a sharp turn and dropped quickly into a vineyard., Various hypotheses about the object's nature included it possibly being a balloon or aircraft.
